itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, June 20, 2013
contentencoded:
Long-term care. It's an economic consequence of an aging America that doesn't get nearly as much attention as Social Security. Nursing homes can run around $100,000 a year, and many aging boomers will not have the money.

Marketplace Economics Correspondent Chris Farrell joins Morning Report's Mark Garrison to discuss.
title: How much should you save for long-term care?
teaser: Nursing homes can run around $100,000 a year, and many aging boomers will not have the money.
